sentence.Network_en: Malcolm believed he was guilty of duplicity in his private dealings.
sentence.Network_cn: 马尔科姆认为他在为其私底下两面派的行为而心生愧疚。

sentence.Network_en: Mercy, how he turned at the man's shameless duplicity.
sentence.Network_cn: 老天啊, 这个家伙的无耻的欺骗行为,实在让人恶心.

sentence.Network_en: His duplicity caused us to distrust him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的口是心非使我们不相信他。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French duplicite or late Latin duplicitas, from Latin duplic- 'twofold' (see duplex)

entry.tran: 奸诈;欺骗;口是心非;两面派
entry.def: If you accuse someone of duplicity, you mean that they are deceitful.

example.ex: Malcolm believed he was guilty of duplicity in his private dealings.
example.tran: 马尔科姆认为他在为其私底下两面派的行为而心生愧疚。

means.word_mean: 2. acting in bad faith; deception by pretending to entertain one set of intentions while acting under the influence of another
